comments.content: Thank you been wondering how pple knew the answer is A

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A host-based firewall on the server is blocking the connection. = When the connection output of Syn-Ack is not coming back through.

This is the result of netstat -a command
WHAT GOOGLE SAYS:
SYN_SENT' is a normal client TCP socket state that is entered after a client issues a connect to a server socket. If acknowledged by the server, the client socket state will proceed to ESTABLISHED.
WHAT CISCO COMMUNITY SAYS:
SYN_SENT: The socket is actively attempting to establish a connection. SYN_RECV: A connection request has been received from the network.
SO, SYN_SENT means connection is not established which means something is blocking the client request to server and most probably it's a firewall, so in my opinion the correct answer is A

Selected Answer: A
A. A host-based firewall on the server is blocking the connection.

this connection is waiting for the server to respond. This most probably means the clientâ€™s request never got to the Server. And 99% of the time, this indicates some sort of Network block due to a firewall.

choices.C: A DoS attack is occurring locally.
choices.A: A host-based firewall on the server is blocking the connection.
choices.D: A routing loop is in the network.
choices.B: Too many collisions are occurring on the network segment.

questions.question_text: Which of the following would be used to indicate when unauthorized access to physical internal hardware has occurred?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Tamper evident seal

A tamper-evident seal is used to indicate when unauthorized access to physical internal hardware has occurred. These seals are designed to break or show visible signs of tampering if someone tries to open or access a piece of equipment or hardware. This provides a visual indication that unauthorized access or tampering has taken place, alerting security personnel to investigate further.

Selected Answer: C
C. Tamper evident seal

Tamper-evident seals are used to indicate when unauthorized access to physical internal hardware has occurred. These seals are designed to show visible signs of tampering or removal, providing an indication that someone has tried to access or manipulate the internal components of a device or system.

Selected Answer: D
- A Wireless LAN (WLAN) controller is a device used to manage a corporate WLAN. The WLAN controller is responsible for centralizing the management of wireless access points (APs), providing a centralized management interface, and automating common WLAN tasks such as security, quality of service (QoS), and radio frequency (RF) management.

Selected Answer: D
it is not router , it is a wireless controller
Wireless controller will be the best answer

questions.question_text: Which of the following devices would be used to manage a corporate WLAN?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Crimp the cable as a straight-through cable.

The issue in this scenario is likely due to the mismatched wiring standards (TIA/EIA 568A on one end and TIA/EIA 568B on the other end) for the Ethernet cable. To fix the problem, the technician should crimp the cable as a straight-through cable, ensuring that both ends follow the same wiring standard (either 568A or 568B). This will establish the proper connections for Ethernet communication between the wall jack and the computer, allowing network connectivity to be restored.

B. Crimp the cable as a straight-through cable.

To resolve the problem, you should ensure that both ends of the cable are crimped with the same standard (either TIA/EIA 568A or TIA/EIA 568B), making it a straight-through cable.

choices.C: Ensure the switchport has STP enabled,
choices.A: Ensure the switchport has PoE enabled.
choices.B: Crimp the cable as a straight-through cable.
choices.D: Crimp the cable as a rollover cable.

questions.question_text: A network technician is investigating a trouble ticket for a user who does not have network connectivity. All patch cables between the wall jacks and computers in the building were upgraded over the weekend from Cat 5 to Cat 6. The newly installed cable is crimped with a TIA/EIA 568A on one end and a TIA/EIA 568B on the other end. Which of the following should the technician do to MOST likely fix the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Network functions virtualization (NFV) is a network architecture concept that leverages IT virtualization technologies to virtualize entire classes of network node functions into building blocks that may connect, or chain together, to create and deliver communication services
